body:
Warning starting pod when using the journald docker logging driver
```
kubectl get events
LASTSEEN   FIRSTSEEN   COUNT     NAME        KIND      SUBOBJECT                  TYPE      REASON                    SOURCE                  MESSAGE
5m         5m          1         127.0.0.1   Node                                 Normal    Starting                  kube-proxy, 127.0.0.1   Starting kube-proxy.
5m         5m          1         127.0.0.1   Node                                 Normal    Starting                  kubelet, 127.0.0.1      Starting kubelet.
5m         5m          1         127.0.0.1   Node                                 Warning   ImageGCFailed             kubelet, 127.0.0.1      unable to find data for container /
5m         5m          2         127.0.0.1   Node                                 Normal    NodeHasSufficientDisk     kubelet, 127.0.0.1      Node 127.0.0.1 status is now: NodeHasSufficientDisk
5m         5m          2         127.0.0.1   Node                                 Normal    NodeHasSufficientMemory   kubelet, 127.0.0.1      Node 127.0.0.1 status is now: NodeHasSufficientMemory
5m         5m          2         127.0.0.1   Node                                 Normal    NodeHasNoDiskPressure     kubelet, 127.0.0.1      Node 127.0.0.1 status is now: NodeHasNoDiskPressure
4m         4m          1         127.0.0.1   Node                                 Normal    RegisteredNode            controllermanager       Node 127.0.0.1 event: Registered Node 127.0.0.1 in NodeController
4m         4m          1         127.0.0.1   Node                                 Normal    NodeReady                 kubelet, 127.0.0.1      Node 127.0.0.1 status is now: NodeReady
4m         4m          3         burstable   Pod                                  Warning   FailedScheduling          default-scheduler       no nodes available to schedule pods
4m         4m          1         burstable   Pod                                  Normal    Scheduled                 default-scheduler       Successfully assigned burstable to 127.0.0.1
4m         4m          1         burstable   Pod                                  Normal    SandboxReceived           kubelet, 127.0.0.1      Pod sandbox received, it will be created.
4m         4m          1         burstable   Pod       spec.containers{busybox}   Normal    Pulling                   kubelet, 127.0.0.1      pulling image "busybox"
4m         4m          1         burstable   Pod       spec.containers{busybox}   Normal    Pulled                    kubelet, 127.0.0.1      Successfully pulled image "busybox"
4m         4m          1         burstable   Pod       spec.containers{busybox}   Normal    Created                   kubelet, 127.0.0.1      Created container with id 29d9bd0e8871504f86064188db223253b84f6d344856041d5b6a376e2f946d33
4m         4m          1         burstable   Pod       spec.containers{busybox}   Warning   Failed                    kubelet, 127.0.0.1      Failed to start container with id 29d9bd0e8871504f86064188db223253b84f6d344856041d5b6a376e2f946d33 with error: rpc error: code = 2 desc = failed to create symbolic link "/var/log/pods/63a3b8a3-f9fe-11e6-90b7-7085c20cf2ab/busybox_0.log" to the container log file "" for container "29d9bd0e8871504f86064188db223253b84f6d344856041d5b6a376e2f946d33": symlink  /var/log/pods/63a3b8a3-f9fe-11e6-90b7-7085c20cf2ab/busybox_0.log: no such file or directory
4m         4m          1         burstable   Pod                                  Warning   FailedSync                kubelet, 127.0.0.1      Error syncing pod, skipping: failed to "StartContainer" for "busybox" with rpc error: code = 2 desc = failed to create symbolic link "/var/log/pods/63a3b8a3-f9fe-11e6-90b7-7085c20cf2ab/busybox_0.log" to the container log file "" for container "29d9bd0e8871504f86064188db223253b84f6d344856041d5b6a376e2f946d33": symlink  /var/log/pods/63a3b8a3-f9fe-11e6-90b7-7085c20cf2ab/busybox_0.log: no such file or directory: "Start Container Failed"
```
This breaks container-level logging
```
kubectl logs burstable
failed to open log file "/var/log/pods/63a3b8a3-f9fe-11e6-90b7-7085c20cf2ab/busybox_0.log": open /var/log/pods/63a3b8a3-f9fe-11e6-90b7-7085c20cf2ab/busybox_0.log: no such file or directory
```
@derekwaynecarr

labels.name: kind/bug

labels.description: Highest priority. Must be actively worked on as someone's top priority right now.
labels.name: priority/critical-urgent

labels.name: sig/node

title: pod logging broken with journald logging driver
